description: A hearty and flavorful one-pan meal where tender pieces of chicken are stir-fried with rice, colorful vegetables, and aromatic seasonings. This Ugandan-style chicken fried rice combines local ingredients with international techniques, resulting in a satisfying dish that's packed with protein and vegetables. The chicken adds savory depth while the vegetables provide crunch and nutrition.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: Chicken fried rice has become a staple in Ugandan urban households, representing the perfect fusion of convenience and flavor. It's particularly valued for its ability to transform leftover rice and chicken into a delicious new meal. The dish is commonly prepared for busy weeknights, student meals, and family gatherings. Many Ugandan home cooks have adapted the recipe to include local vegetables and spices, making it their own while maintaining the classic fried rice appeal.

ingredients.name: Cooked White Rice (preferably day-old)
ingredients.notes: Cold rice works best for fried rice

steps.instruction: Break up the cold cooked rice with your fingers to separate the grains and prevent clumping during frying.
Cut chicken into small, bite-sized cubes. Season with chicken seasoning powder, salt, and black pepper.
Beat the eggs in a small bowl with a pinch of salt.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large wok or frying pan over high heat.
Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble until cooked through. Remove from the pan and set aside.
Add another tablespoon of oil to the same pan. Add the seasoned chicken and stir-fry for 4-5 minutes until cooked through and lightly browned. Remove and set aside with the eggs.
Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to the pan. Add chopped onion and saut√© for 2 minutes until translucent.
Add minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add diced carrots and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
Add green peas and diced green pepper. Stir-fry for 1-2 minutes until vegetables are tender but still crisp.
Add the cooked rice to the pan. Stir well to combine with the vegetables.
Pour soy sauce and oyster sauce (if using) evenly over the rice. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until everything is well combined.
Add the cooked chicken and scrambled eggs back into the pan. Stir gently to distribute evenly.
Continue stir-frying for 2-3 minutes until everything is heated through and the rice has a slightly crispy texture.

cooking_indicators.visual: Rice should be steaming hot with some crispy bits

steps.instruction: Drizzle with sesame oil and stir in most of the chopped spring onions, reserving some for garnish.
Taste and adjust seasoning if needed. The fried rice should be savory and well-balanced.
Serve hot, garnished with the remaining spring onions.

serving_suggestions: Serve as a complete meal on its own or with a simple side salad. It pairs well with a wedge of lemon or lime for extra freshness. For a Ugandan twist, serve with a side of tomato and onion salad (Kachumbari) or sliced avocado. Also excellent with chili sauce or hot sauce for those who prefer extra heat.
